author: plusminushalf
content: Hey, yes I intend to work on AA. I am looking around making a chrome-extension app that can highlight all the features of the AA. Think of this Metamask for AA.

author: plusminushalf
content: Interesting aspect, would love to know more

author: vidkersic
content: Hey <@784463459218751528>, one of the topics I would love to work on is AA. For the browser extension, I was thinking about MetaMask Snap, which implements AA, which could be faster to develop than the extension from scratch. It would be great also to support BLS signatures. Happy to collaborate/discuss that

author: plusminushalf
content: Hey I haven't tried MM Snaps. Let me try my hands over it and then we can discuss. As of now I was thinking of forking Tally-Ho and building over it.

author: plusminushalf
content: Also snaps are not released to the public, do you know the timeline for it? I wouldn't want the app to be dependent on MetaMask snaps release.

author: vidkersic
content: Tally is also cool. True, you can try them on dev edition of MetaMask - Flask. But you can already develop them - if I remeber correctly there is already one for starknet accounts

author: lancenonce
content:
I used this during the ETH Bogota hackathon to see what Snaps were all about: https://etherworld.co/2022/01/19/a-quick-guide-to-metamask-snaps/

ended up not hacking on them, but want to do it for Denver. There was also a workshop during devcon with their lead eng
